subject: Sexual Health
title: Precocious Puberty
description: A micro-lesson that makes Precocious Puberty usable.

hook.text: When puberty begins before age 8 in girls or 9 in boys, it is called precocious puberty.

buildup.text: Early puberty can be caused by brain signals firing too soon, tumors, or exposure to external hormones.

discovery.text: Children with precocious puberty may initially be tall but end up shorter as adults because growth plates close early.

twist.text: Treatment with GnRH agonists can pause puberty, giving the child time to grow and develop emotionally.

climax.text: Early detection and treatment protect both physical growth and psychological well-being in affected children.

punchline.text: Too early, too fast. But medicine can slow it down.

quiz.question: Why can precocious puberty lead to shorter adult height?
